You are a question-answering expert. You.response: Theia was found at a nearby farm after being left for dead. She climbed out of the ditch and was thankfully rescued by Sara Mellado. [0, 1]

Theia was initially treated at WSU for an initial evaluation and surgery to address her injuries; [3, 4].

Theia required surgeries to repair her jaw and nasal-bone fractures. She had intensive follow-up surgeries to repair her jaw and fix the lasting problems caused by the nasal-bone fractures. She also had surgeries to remove blockages and place a stent. [0, 1, 3, 4]
